name: Greater Yellownape
description: Yellownapes are close relatives of woodpeckers, belonging to the order Piciformes. The Greater Yellownape has the typical greenish coloration of most yellownapes, with males distinguished by a bright yellow crest of elongated feathers at the nape.
spread_note: Southern Asia, from India to the Himalayas and Indonesia
food_note: Invertebrates including ants and termites, also seeds and berries
image_alt: Greater Yellownape, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 21–22.5 cm, tail length 12.2–12.5 cm, wing length 15–15.5 cm, weight 100–198 g
reproduction: The female lays 2 eggs, incubation lasts 11 days.
attractions: This species inhabits a wide range across seven subspecies in southern Asian forests. Small groups of four or five move discreetly through trees, collecting small insects.
